oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Estimating the Number Of Roots of Trinomials over Finite Fields
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kelley, Zander
Owen, Sean
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Number Theory
Mathematics - Algebraic Geometry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We show that univariate trinomials $x^n + ax^s + b \in \mathbb{F}_q[x]$ can have at most $\delta \Big\lfloor \frac{1}{2} +\sqrt{\frac{q-1}{\delta}} \Big\rfloor$ distinct roots in $\mathbb{F}_q$, where $\delta = \gcd(n, s, q - 1)$. We also derive explicit trinomials having $\sqrt{q}$ roots in $\mathbb{F}_q$ when $q$ is square and $\delta=1$, thus showing that our bound is tight for an infinite family of finite fields and trinomials. Furthermore, we present the results of a large-scale computation which suggest that an $O(\delta \log q)$ upper bound may be possible for the special case where $q$ is prime. Finally, we give a conjecture (along with some accompanying computational and theoretical support) that, if true, would imply such a bound.
